snippet: Investigators looking into a rigging collapse that killed seven people and injured dozens during a storm last summer also found problems with the emergency planning.
abstract: Investigators looking into a rigging collapse that killed seven people and injured dozens at a 2011 Indiana State Fair discover that rigging did not meet industry standards and that accident was exacerbated by the absence of a fully developed emergency plan.
lead_paragraph: Investigators looking into a rigging collapse that killed seven people and injured dozens during a storm last summer also found problems with the emergency planning.

headline.seo: Indiana State Fair Rigging Did Not Meet Code, Reports Say
headline.main: Rigging That Killed 7 at Indiana Fair Was Below Code, Studies Say
headline.print_headline: Rigging That Killed 7 at Indiana Fair Was Below Code, Studies Say
